titleText: NYPD, which was using Windows Phones, is upgrading to the iPhone
mainText: The New York City Police Department is upgrading to the iPhone. The agency confirmed Tuesday it will replace 36,000 Windows Phones secured as part of a Mobility Initiative with Apple's iPhones. The NYPD says the new iPhones…

titleText: Does Microsoft's brass still believe it has a chance in the phone market?
mainText: A New York Post report that one of Microsoft's more celebrated U.S. business customers for Windows Phones is dumping the platform raises some interesting questions about Redmond's future mobility plans. The Post reported on August 28…

titleText: Microsoft Expands Power BI Report Server Data Source Support
mainText: Microsoft has extended Power BI Report Server reach, allowing customer organizations to glean insights from a greater variety of business information. Debuting earlier this year, Power BI Report Server allows users to host reports created with…

titleText: Windows 10 Gets Another Exciting Feature In Its Next Update
mainText: The Fall Creators Edition, the second of this year's 'Creators' updates will feature support for Microsoft's mixed reality devices, the company has said in a blog post. These are an attempt at bringing VR headsets…

titleText: Microsoft is trying to make VR mainstream. Here’s why it might succeed
mainText: It’s been a long time since Microsoft first announced native support for VR headsets – made by partners like Dell, Asus, and HP – in Windows. Nearly a year later, those headsets are finally ready…
